description: Aquarium setup methods Aquaria can reference when generating a build plan. Each method includes aliases for search/routing and concise operational guidance.

methods.name: Classic Flooded Startup
methods.summary: Fill on day one, plant submerged, run filter/heater, fishless cycle before livestock.
when_to_use: Fastest path to a planted community tank

lighting.notes: Start low; increase slowly after cycling.

methods.filtration: Sponge or gentle HOB/canister sized to tank; surface agitation for oxygenation.
methods.fertilization: optional (low-dose after week 2 if pale growth)

week0_1: Rinse tank & gear, place hardscape, plant submerged.
Fill with dechlorinated water; start filter and heater.
Dose bottled bacteria; add a small ammonia source.
Test daily; partial changes only if ammonia/nitrite spike dangerously.
week2_4: Light 6–8 h/day; feed imaginary (pinch) to sustain cycle.
Add hardy livestock only after ammonia and nitrite = 0 for 3 consecutive days.

maintenance: Rinse prefilter sponge in tank water; trim plants lightly.

methods.name: Dry Start Method
methods.summary: Grow carpets emersed on moist substrate with high humidity before flooding; reduces early algae and yields dense roots.
when_to_use: Low-tech tanks needing strong root base

lighting.notes: Bright but not hot; avoid drying edges.

methods.filtration: Install hardware but do not run submerged until flood.
methods.fertilization: nutrient-rich substrate or root tabs under carpet

week0_1: Lay substrate (nutrient layer if used), hardscape, and plant carpets densely.
Mist thoroughly; cover to maintain humidity; vent daily to prevent mold.
week2_4: Continue misting; trim runners to thicken.
Flood slowly over 1–3 days; start filter/heater; begin cycling submerged.

maintenance: During dry phase: daily misting and 10–15 min ventilation.
not_for: Very large/deep tanks (humidity control is harder)

methods.name: Walstad Method
methods.summary: Low-tech planted tank using a soil substrate capped with sand/gravel; dense planting; minimal filtration; no injected CO₂.
when_to_use: Shrimp/small fish in classrooms or offices

lighting.notes: Moderate light to match natural nutrient processing.

methods.filtration: Gentle flow (sponge/air); plants handle most biofiltration.
methods.fertilization: generally none; add root tabs later only if plants show deficiency

week0_1: Soil base (additive-free) capped with 1–2 cm sand/gravel.
Plant heavily from day one with fast growers and floaters.
Fill slowly to avoid disturbing soil; run gentle aeration.
week2_6: Light 6–7 h; avoid overfeeding; test weekly.
Large early water changes if ammonia rises or water is tea-colored; lengthen intervals as plants establish.

maintenance: Light weekly trims; top-offs; less-frequent water changes once stable.
Vacuum very lightly to avoid disturbing the soil cap.

methods.name: Biotope / Blackwater
methods.summary: Recreate a specific natural habitat with matching water chemistry, botanicals, and species.

lighting.notes: Dim to moderate; tannins reduce PAR.

methods.filtration: Gentle flow; pre-filter to avoid clogging with botanicals.

week0_1: Place hardscape and botanicals (leaves, seed pods) and soak/rinse as needed.
Fill and run filter/aeration; expect initial tint from tannins.
week2_5: Monitor pH/KH; add botanicals gradually; replace as they break down.
Stock only compatible, region-accurate species after cycle.

maintenance: Periodic top-offs and partial changes; refresh botanicals.
Vacuum lightly to protect microfauna layers.

methods.name: Dirtless Ecosystem
methods.summary: Planted tank that avoids raw soil; uses inert substrate plus fertilizers/root tabs to mimic a balanced ecosystem.
methods.filtration: Gentle to moderate depending on livestock.
methods.fertilization: water-column dosing and/or root tabs per plant demand

week0_1: Fill and start filter/heater; begin fishless cycling.
week2_4: Start light dosing if plants pale; increase only as needed.

maintenance: Adjust dosing to keep nitrate <20 ppm.

methods.name: High-Tech CO₂
methods.summary: Pressurized CO₂, higher light, and regular fertilization for fast plant growth and tight trims.
methods.filtration: Robust but not turbulent; stable CO₂ distribution.
methods.co2: pressurized CO₂ 20–30 mg/L target; drop-checker lime green
methods.fertilization: regular macros/micros (e.g., EI or lean dosing), tailored to bioload

week0_1: Plant densely; set CO₂ to start 1–2 h before lights; ensure even flow.
Begin lean ferts; monitor pH drop and livestock behavior.
week2_4: Dial in CO₂ and light; increase gradually; add livestock after cycle stabilizes.

maintenance: Frequent trims to prevent shade and instability.
